text: There are not, unfortunately. The bottleneck in reading these files is the decompression, so perhaps you could call a binary for multithreaded decompression like pigz? If you're willing to have a slightly lower compression ratio, you can compress it in the BGZF format and read it with CodecBGZF.jl, which is quite fast (and support random access).

elements.text: There are not, unfortunately. The bottleneck in reading these files is the decompression, so perhaps you could call a binary for multithreaded decompression like pigz? If you're willing to have a slightly lower compression ratio, you can compress it in the BGZF format and read it with CodecBGZF.jl, which is quite fast (and support random access).

text: My understanding is that decompression in pigz isn't multithreaded, other than being able to decomp multiple files in parallel (but not a single file across multiple cores).
